node.name: system
node.description: Enclosing container for system-related configuration and operational state dataNone

node.name: config
node.description: Global configuration data for the systemNone

node.name: hostname
node.description: The hostname of the device -- should be a single domain label, without the domain.None

node.name: domain-name
node.description: Specifies the domain name used to form fully qualified name for unqualified hostnames.None

node.name: login-banner
node.description: The console login message displayed before the login prompt, i.e., before a user logs into the system.None

node.name: motd-banner
node.description: The console message displayed after a user logs into the system. They system may append additional standard information such as the current system date and time, uptime, last login timestamp, etc.None

node.name: state
node.description: Global operational state data for the systemNone

node.name: hostname
node.description: The hostname of the device -- should be a single domain label, without the domain.None

node.name: domain-name
node.description: Specifies the domain name used to form fully qualified name for unqualified hostnames.None

node.name: login-banner
node.description: The console login message displayed before the login prompt, i.e., before a user logs into the system.None

node.name: motd-banner
node.description: The console message displayed after a user logs into the system. They system may append additional standard information such as the current system date and time, uptime, last login timestamp, etc.None

node.name: current-datetime
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The current system date and time.None

node.name: boot-time
node.description: This timestamp indicates the time that the system was last restarted. The value is the timestamp in seconds relative to the Unix Epoch (Jan 1, 1970 00:00:00 UTC).None

node.name: clock
node.description: Top-level container for clock configuration dataNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for system clockNone

node.name: timezone-name
node.description: The TZ database name to use for the system, such as 'Europe/Stockholm'.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for system clockNone

node.name: timezone-name
node.description: The TZ database name to use for the system, such as 'Europe/Stockholm'.None

node.name: dns
node.description: Enclosing container for DNS resolver dataNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for the DNS resolverNone

node.name: search
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
An ordered list of domains to search when resolving a host name.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for the DNS resolverNone

node.name: search
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
An ordered list of domains to search when resolving a host name.None

node.name: servers
node.description: Enclosing container for DNS resolver listNone

node.name: server
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
List of the DNS servers that the resolver should query.
When the resolver is invoked by a calling application, it sends the query to the first name server in this list. If no response has been received within 'timeout' seconds, the resolver continues with the next server in the list. If no response is received from any server, the resolver continues with the first server again. When the resolver has traversed the list 'attempts' times without receiving any response, it gives up and returns an error to the calling application.
Implementations MAY limit the number of entries in this list.None

node.name: address
node.description: References the configured address of the DNS serverNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for each DNS resolverNone

node.name: address
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The address of the DNS server, can be either IPv4 or IPv6.None

node.name: port
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The port number of the DNS server.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for each DNS resolverNone

node.name: address
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The address of the DNS server, can be either IPv4 or IPv6.None

node.name: port
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The port number of the DNS server.None

node.description: List of static host entriesNone

node.description: Reference to the hostname list keyNone

node.description: Configuration data for static host entriesNone

node.description: List of IPv4 addressses for the host entryNone

node.description: Operational state data for static host entriesNone

node.description: Hostname for the static DNS entryNone

node.name: ipv4-address

node.name: ntp
node.description: Top-level container for NTP configuration and stateNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for NTP client.None

node.name: enabled
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Enables the NTP protocol and indicates that the system should attempt to synchronize the system clock with an NTP server from the servers defined in the 'ntp/server' list.None

node.name: ntp-source-address
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Source address to use on outgoing NTP packetsNone

node.name: enable-ntp-auth
node.description: Enable or disable NTP authentication -- when enabled, the system will only use packets containing a trusted authentication key to synchronize the time.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for NTP services.None

node.name: enabled
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Enables the NTP protocol and indicates that the system should attempt to synchronize the system clock with an NTP server from the servers defined in the 'ntp/server' list.None

node.name: ntp-source-address
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Source address to use on outgoing NTP packetsNone

node.name: enable-ntp-auth
node.description: Enable or disable NTP authentication -- when enabled, the system will only use packets containing a trusted authentication key to synchronize the time.None

node.name: auth-mismatch
node.description: Count of the number of NTP packets received that were not processed due to authentication mismatch.None

node.name: ntp-keys
node.description: Enclosing container for list of NTP authentication keysNone

node.name: ntp-key
node.description: List of NTP authentication keysNone

node.name: key-id
node.description: Reference to auth key-id list keyNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for NTP auth keysNone

node.name: key-id
node.description: Integer identifier used by the client and server to designate a secret key. The client and server must use the same key id.None

node.name: key-type
node.description: Encryption type used for the NTP authentication keyNone

node.name: key-value
node.description: NTP authentication key valueNone

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for NTP auth keysNone

node.name: key-id
node.description: Integer identifier used by the client and server to designate a secret key. The client and server must use the same key id.None

node.name: key-type
node.description: Encryption type used for the NTP authentication keyNone

node.name: key-value
node.description: NTP authentication key valueNone

node.name: servers
node.description: Enclosing container for the list of NTP serversNone

node.name: server
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
List of NTP servers to use for system clock synchronization. If '/system/ntp/enabled' is 'true', then the system will attempt to contact and utilize the specified NTP servers.None

node.name: address
node.description: References the configured address or hostname of the NTP server.None

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for an NTP server.None

node.name: address
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The address or hostname of the NTP server.None

node.name: port
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The port number of the NTP server.None

node.name: version
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Version number to put in outgoing NTP packetsNone

node.name: association-type
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The desired association type for this NTP server.None

node.name: iburst
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Indicates whether this server should enable burst synchronization or not.None

node.name: prefer
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Indicates whether this server should be preferred or not.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for an NTP server.None

node.name: address
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The address or hostname of the NTP server.None

node.name: port
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The port number of the NTP server.None

node.name: version
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Version number to put in outgoing NTP packetsNone

node.name: association-type
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
The desired association type for this NTP server.None

node.name: iburst
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Indicates whether this server should enable burst synchronization or not.None

node.name: prefer
node.description:
[adapted from IETF system model RFC 7317]
Indicates whether this server should be preferred or not.None

node.name: stratum
node.description:
Indicates the level of the server in the NTP hierarchy. As stratum number increases, the accuracy is degraded. Primary servers are stratum while a maximum value of 16 indicates unsynchronized. The values have the following specific semantics:
| 0 | unspecified or invalid | 1 | primary server (e.g., equipped with a GPS receiver) | 2-15 | secondary server (via NTP) | 16 | unsynchronized | 17-255 | reservedNone

node.name: root-delay
node.description: The round-trip delay to the server, in milliseconds.None

node.name: root-dispersion
node.description: Dispersion (epsilon) represents the maximum error inherent in the measurementNone

node.name: offset
node.description: Estimate of the current time offset from the peer. This is the time difference between the local and reference clock.None

node.name: poll-interval
node.description: Polling interval of the peerNone

node.name: ssh-server
node.description: Top-level container for ssh serverNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for the system ssh serverNone

node.name: enable
node.description: Enables the ssh server. The ssh server is enabled by default.None

node.name: protocol-version
node.description: Set the protocol version for SSH connections to the systemNone

node.name: timeout
node.description: Set the idle timeout in seconds on terminal connections to the system for the protocol.None

node.name: rate-limit
node.description: Set a limit on the number of connection attempts per minute to the system for the protocol.None

node.name: session-limit
node.description: Set a limit on the number of simultaneous active terminal sessions to the system for the protocol (e.g., ssh, telnet, ...) None

node.name: aaa

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for global authentication servicesNone

node.name: authentication-method
node.description: Ordered list of authentication methods for users. This can be either a reference to a server group, or a well- defined designation in the AAA_METHOD_TYPE identity. If authentication fails with one method, the next defined method is tried -- failure of all methods results in the user being denied access.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for global authentication servicesNone

node.name: authentication-method
node.description: Ordered list of authentication methods for users. This can be either a reference to a server group, or a well- defined designation in the AAA_METHOD_TYPE identity. If authentication fails with one method, the next defined method is tried -- failure of all methods results in the user being denied access.None

node.name: admin-user
node.description: Top-level container for the system root or admin user configuration and operational stateNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for the root user accountNone

node.name: admin-password
node.description: The admin/root password, supplied as a cleartext string. The system should encrypt and only store the password as an encrypted value.None

node.name: admin-password-encrypted
node.description: The admin/root password, supplied as an encrypted value using the notation described in the definition of the crypt-password-type.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for the root user accountNone

node.name: admin-password
node.description: The admin/root password, supplied as a cleartext string. The system should encrypt and only store the password as an encrypted value.None

node.name: admin-password-encrypted
node.description: The admin/root password, supplied as an encrypted value using the notation described in the definition of the crypt-password-type.None

node.name: admin-username
node.description: Name of the administrator user account, e.g., admin, root, etc.None

node.description: Enclosing container list of local usersNone

node.description: List of local users on the systemNone

node.description: References the configured username for the userNone

node.description: Configuration data for local usersNone

node.description: The user password, supplied as cleartext. The system must encrypt the value and only store the encrypted value.None

node.name: password-encrypted
node.description: The user password, supplied as an encrypted value using the notation described in the definition of the crypt-password-type.None

node.name: ssh-key
node.description: SSH public key for the user (RSA or DSA)None

node.name: role
node.description: Role assigned to the user. The role may be supplied as a string or a role defined by the SYSTEM_DEFINED_ROLES identity.None

node.name: role
node.description: Role assigned to the user. The role may be supplied as a string or a role defined by the SYSTEM_DEFINED_ROLES identity.None

node.name: authorization
node.description: Top-level container for AAA authorization configuration and operational state dataNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration data for authorization based on AAA methodsNone

node.name: authorization-method
node.description: Ordered list of methods for authorizing commands. The first method that provides a response (positive or negative) should be used. The list may contain a well-defined method such as the set of all TACACS or RADIUS servers, or the name of a defined AAA server group. The system must validate that the named server group exists.None

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state data for authorization based on AAANone

node.name: authorization-method
node.description: Ordered list of methods for authorizing commands. The first method that provides a response (positive or negative) should be used. The list may contain a well-defined method such as the set of all TACACS or RADIUS servers, or the name of a defined AAA server group. The system must validate that the named server group exists.None

node.description: The process pidNone

node.description: The process nameNone

node.name: args
node.description: Current process command line arguments. Arguments with a parameter (e.g., --option 10 or -option=10) should be represented as a single element of the list with the argument name and parameter together. Flag arguments, i.e., those without a parameter should also be in their own list element.None

node.name: start-time
node.description: The time at which this process started, reported as nanoseconds since the UNIX epoch. The system must be synchronized such that the start-time can be reported accurately, otherwise it should not be reported.None

node.name: uptime
node.description: Amount of time elapsed since this process started.None

node.name: cpu-usage-user
node.description: CPU time consumed by this process in user mode.None

node.name: cpu-usage-system
node.description: CPU time consumed by this process in kernel mode.None

node.name: cpu-utilization
node.description: The percentage of CPU that is being used by the process.None

node.name: memory-usage
node.description: Bytes allocated and still in use by the processNone

node.name: memory-utilization
node.description: The percentage of RAM that is being used by the process.None
